reviews.title: Not great, but not bad
reviews.text: I wish they had 3.5 stars for places such as this motel.

reviews.title: hotel owner mr patel has no customer service skills
reviews.text: Based on the preceding comments, I was expecting "Fawlty Towers" - California style. The Sandman turned out to be (overall) nicer than I'd been fearing. Staff was very pleasant, room was in good shape, etc. Very quiet, even for being right by I-5. I had no car so the complimentary airport shuttle was a huge saving at $30 each way for a taxi otherwise.

reviews.title: Not worth 3 starts from AAA
reviews.text: However ... their "local service" is limited to the Greyhound and Amtrak stations; that still leaves a fair hike from there to many downtown sites. Sacramento is about the only city I've been to with a "minimum taxi fare" of $10 (eek!) when the engine starts; on average, the Sandman ran a couple bucks under that on the meter so those cabbies got pretty generous differentials. But, I knew the location before I arrived. Here are the two main "negatives" I found: 1) the breakfast was pretty poor (lousy coffee - in-room was as good, if not better; juice; cereal; toast; tasteless pastries/muffins) and the tiny breakfast room seemed mobbed my second day with 8 diners. 2) The "hot" water barely got above warm; no danger of scalding if one stands under hot-tap-only for a shower.

reviews.title: Location was great for our needs.
reviews.text: For under $70/night, it was still a better deal than the comparable in-town places for nearly double my rate (and no shuttle!). Recommended with a car for a night or two.

reviews.title: Just Terrible
reviews.text: Mr patel is terrible and when he speaks he mumbles and u don't understand. i told him that there was a leak in the bath room on the day i checked in. he never did anything nor offered another room. i called customer service and the made a file for me and got back to me 3 days and they told me that mr patel offered 30% off and another room. i was upset and asked them what is customer service going to do about his lies. they told me that they can't choose sides and wouldn't be able to do anything becuase conflict of stories.

Check-in was easy and uneventful. The room had a microwave and refrigerator, which was nice, but there were little things within the room that were a cause for concern. First among these was the various different colors of spots on the bedsheets. I ended up pulling one of the sheets off of the bed and replacing it with a sheet from the pull-out couch.
reviews.title: Decent room for the price paid.

likes.liked: — Location - I had an early flight out

reviews.text: Freeway noise wasn't much of an issue for me, but I can see how it might be for others. This is a motel located on a row of budget motels, and as those go I would expect that this location is among the better ones.
reviews.title: Don on Route 66 (and beyond)

reviews.text: I am on the road for 21 days. 21 days, 19 motels.
reviews.title: Not that great....
Nice hotel
reviews.text: I am following RT 66 from Chicago to Santa Monica. I will continue from there up the California coast thru San Francisco and I will end my journey in Sacramento. From there I will fly back to Chicago. I will review my every stop on the way. I am Don on Route 66 (and now beyond).

reviews.title: Loved this Best Western!
reviews.text: Sacramento is the last stop of my little journey. Just a place to lie in the sun and unwind before heading back to Chicago.
